results.title: Numbers now and then (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jean Nunn, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Mathematics”.
Concerns the history of written numbers. Illustrates different features of the numeral systems of the ancient Babylonians, Egyptians and Greeks. Explains the Hindu-Arabic origin of our number system.

results.title: Quaternions: A herald of modern algebra (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of Mathematics”.
A key mathematical development in modern algebraic ideas was the discovery of non-commutative algebras. William Rowan Hamilton worked on complex numbers and expressed them formally as pairs of real numbers. His work led him to try to generalise his ideas to three dimension but his generalisation to four dimensions led to the quaternion and the first non-commutative algebra.

results.title: The Diaries of Vaslav Nijinsky
results.creator_credit: Paul Cox, Aanya Whitehead, AFFC, Illumination Films (AU) and MusicArtsDance Films
results.brief_description: Poetic musing of a life drawn from diaries left by one of the world’s most famous ballet dancers. Vaslav Nijinski was a dynamic force in ballet, wanting to broaden the possibilities of dance - perhaps ahead of his time. Imagery from the natural world mixed with interpretations of ballets, historical documents and re-creations of the people and times of his life, are all lead by rich voice of Derek Jacobi, who narrates as Nijinsky reading directly from the dancer’s diaries. Thoughts on his career, his sexuality, his mental health and general place in the world reveal some of the inner turmoil of the man and his artistic temperament. His career was short lived as Nijinsky became mentally ill, remaining in an institution until his death in 1950. Directed and edited by Paul Cox “The Diaries” is a work that demonstrates the filmmaker’s passion for the dancer and writer that was Nijinsky. A co-production of Australia, Sweden, Germany and Netherlands. Original music by Paul Grabowsky. Cast includes Chris Haywood, Delia Silvan, Hans Sonneveld, Oliver Streeton, Jillian Smith.

results.title: The Devil at your heels
results.creator_credit: Adam Symansky, Bill Brind, Robert Fortier and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The late Ken Carter’s long-time obsession to be the world’s greatest daredevil is the subject of this feature length documentary. Seen are the five years of preparation that went into raising one million dollars, building a rocket-powered car, and constructing a ten-storey take-off ramp for his attempt to jump a car across a mile-wide stretch of the St. Lawrence River. A portrait of a stunt driver who made his living by risking his life. Photography by Barry Perles. Narrated by Gordon Pinsent. (Awards: Genie, Toronto)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Adam Symansky, Bill Brind, Robert Fortier and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Detour
results.creator_credit: Shelby Leverington, Caroline Mouris and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: A film experienced entirely from the point of view of an elderly patient dying in a large hospital. As modern medicine struggles to keep eighty three year old Catherine Hamilton alive she struggles just as hard to die in peace. Each time she thinks she may be able to slip away, the doctors and nurses bring her back with a wonder drug, or a new machine. But Catherine continues to fight to control her own destiny with humour and dignity

results.title: The Decision
results.creator_credit: Julian Biggs, Larry Gosnel and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The conflict arises in the Canadian rural scene where the pressures of rising prices, competitive markets, higher production costs, force farmers to abandon their traditional views of farming as a way of life, for one that places it on high levels of business. Shows how a father, holding on to old ways, and son holding onto new, resolve differences in such a way as to enable them to keep abreast of advancement in agriculture. Based on the short story by Charles Israel.

results.title: The Decision
results.creator_credit: Vera Neubauer and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: An experimental film using a mixture of animation and live action which contrasts the fantasy and romantic ideals of the traditional fairy tale with the life of an ordinary woman confined to her home.

results.title: The Days of Whiskey Gap
results.creator_credit: Colin Low, Roman Kroitor, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The 1870s were years of grave crises in the Canadian West. American whiskey traders were victimizing the Indians. Chief Sitting Bull and his Sioux warriors, fresh from their victory over the US Cavalry, were camped near the Cypress Hills, and the stage was set for tragedy. In 1873, the North-West Mounted Police were established to maintain law and order in the newly acquired North-West Territories. The following summer a courageous expedition trekked 800 miles from Fort Dufferin, south of Winnipeg, to Fort Whoopup, near present-day Lethbridge. The force raised the flag and proclaimed the Queen’s law, ensuring that the Canadian West would not become a lawless American-style frontier. This film brings to life some of the legends of the men in the scarlet tunics.

results.title: Darcy's story
results.brief_description: Darcy is a 6 year old who loves his Mum, hanging out with his mates and Elvis’ cool guitar styles. Made as part of the ‘Pride and Diversity’ workshop in association with Vic Health.
